1: Watchword for the week — I will recount the gracious deeds of the Lord, the praiseworthy acts of the Lord, because of all that the Lord has done for us. Isaiah 63:7
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and behold the face of God? Psalm 42:2
For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who searches finds, and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened. Matthew 7:8
Lord, thank you for the gift of curiosity, the hunger to know more of you, and the desire to grow deeper roots into the soil of your grace and love. We ask, Lord, and you respond. Amen.
2: Is Ephraim my dear son? Is he the child I delight in? As often as I speak against him, I still remember him. Therefore I am deeply moved for him; I will surely have mercy on him, says the Lord. Jeremiah 31:20
God, who is rich in mercy, out of the great love with which he loved us even when we were dead through our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ. Ephesians 2:4-5

Merciful God, we are grateful for your tenderness and patience with our failures and flaws. Help us to fix our hearts on the power of your love and the transformation it brings, as we journey with our imperfections. Amen.
3: Lord, plead my cause and redeem me; revive me according to your word. Psalm 119:154 NKJV
The Lord is faithful; he will strengthen you and guard you from the evil one. 2 Thessalonians 3:3
We are not alone, Lord. You stand with us and you watch over us. Help us to stand with others in their time of need. Amen.
4: The angel of the Lord touched Elijah, and said, “Get up and eat, otherwise the journey will be too much for you.” 1 Kings 19:7
Therefore, lift your drooping hands and strengthen your weak knees, and make straight paths for your feet. Hebrews 12:12-13
Merciful God, help us to remember that when we feel weak and are struggling, we can turn to you. Sustain us with your spirit and direct us through the day. In your name, we pray. Amen.
5: O God, from my youth you have taught me, and I still proclaim your wondrous deeds. Psalm 71:17

Simeon said, “Lord, now you are letting your servant depart in peace, according to your word; for my eyes have seen your salvation which you have prepared before the face of all peoples.” Luke 2:29-31 NKJV

Abiding God, you remain a constant source of comfort in our lives. We can see where your hand has been upon us in the past and we have hope for where you will lead us. We celebrate the promises fulfilled in our lives through your grace and love for us. Amen.
6: Watchword for the Epiphany — Arise, shine; for your light has come, and the glory of the Lord has risen upon you. Isaiah 60:1

Hezekiah became sick and was at the point of death. He prayed to the Lord, and he answered him and gave him a sign. But Hezekiah did not respond according to the benefit done to him for his heart was proud. 2 Chronicles 32:24-25
God opposes the proud, but gives grace to the humble. 1 Peter 5:5
Give us humble hearts, gracious God, that we may see the world as you desire it to be and that we might know our place in it. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
7: From the rising of the sun to its setting, the name of the Lord is to be praised. Psalm 113:3

May the God of steadfastness and encouragement grant you to live in harmony with one another, in accordance with Christ Jesus, so that together you may with one voice glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. Romans 15:5-6
Lord, give us a spirit of cooperation and goodwill. Help us to see the pathway within our circumstance where we can journey alongside others for your glory. Amen.
8: Watchword for the week — A bruised reed he will not break, and a dimly burning wick he will not quench; he will faithfully bring forth justice. Isaiah 42:3
Give generously to your needy brother and do so without a grudging heart. Deuteronomy 15:10 NIV
Give and it will be given to you. Luke 6:38

Lord, as you have been generous with us through the blessings of your limitless love, we pray that we may have that same generous spirit. Empower us to give freely to others in ways that would best serve them. Help us to give without judgement or fear, trusting in your providence for us all. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
9: You shall not join hands with the wicked to act as a malicious witness. Exodus 23:1

Finally, beloved, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is pleasing, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence and if there is anything worthy of praise, think about these things. Philippians 4:8
Rock of ages, we pray for the strength to stand with unwavering conviction for faith, love, and hope. Keep our hearts grounded in your grace while we labor for your goodness in this world. Amen.
10: Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh, and bring the Israelites out of Egypt?” God said, “I will be with you.” Exodus 3:11-12
Jesus said, “See, I am sending you out like sheep into the midst of wolves; so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.” Matthew 10:16

Lord, you are a God who sends. You sent your Son to us that we might be forgiven and restored to you. You now send us out as agents of your grace. We do not go by our own power or strength, but by trusting in you. Amen.
11: The Lord has heard my supplication, the Lord accepts my prayer. Psalm 6:9
Whenever you pray, go into your room and shut the door and pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you. Matthew 6:6

Lord, we thank you for your listening ear. In humility, we come to you with the burdens and concerns of our hearts, knowing that you care for us and we are not alone. We thank you for the assurance we find in this blessing. Amen.
12: So now, O Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you? Only to fear the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, to love him, to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul. Deuteronomy 10:12
Whoever obeys his word, truly in this person the love of God has reached perfection. 1 John 2:5

Divine Wisdom, help us to understand that obedience to your commandments leads us on the pathway of the liberating power of your love. We pray for the strength to surrender all and put our trust in you. Amen.
13: Do not fear, or be afraid; have I not told you from of old and declared it? You are my witnesses! Isaiah 44:8
So we are ambassadors for Christ, since God is making his appeal through us; we entreat you on behalf of Christ, be reconciled to God. 2 Corinthians 5:20

Holy Redeemer, as we face the needs of the world around us, help us to be bold in our witness, loving in our service, and overflowing with hope. It is for you that we bring the good news to the nations. Amen.
14: Your eyes beheld my unformed substance. In your book were written all the days that were formed for me. Psalm 139:16
Do not worry about your life. Matthew 6:25
Savior, we lay our burdens down. Lord, we trust in your providence. Clear our minds and calm our hearts as we stand on your promises for now and for eternity. Amen.
15: Watchword for the Week — God is faithful; by him you were called into the fellowship of his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord. 1 Corinthians 1:9
To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice. Proverbs 21:3
For just as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is also dead. James 2:26

Loving God, raise us up to do the good you would have us do. Open our eyes, ears, and hearts to those who are oppressed and marginalized. May our efforts on their behalf glorify you. We pray this, in the name of Jesus. Amen.
16: My lips will shout for joy when I sing praises to you; my soul also, which you have rescued. Psalm 71:23
Joyfully give thanks to the Father, who has enabled you to share in the inheritance of the saints in the light. Colossians 1:11-12
God of constant delight, we thank you for your unlimited grace given to us. We stand with all those who have gone before us in a community of light that gives hope and healing. Amen.
17: I treasure your word in my heart, so that I may not sin against you. Psalm 119:11
Guard the good treasure entrusted to you, with the help of the Holy Spirit living in us.2 Timothy 1:14
Eternal Word, we are grateful that you have given us knowledge of your will for us through scripture and the Holy Spirit. We pray for the wisdom and strength to live out your will daily. Amen.
18: You in your mercy have led forth the people whom you have redeemed. Exodus 15:13 NKJV
Christ also suffered for sins once for all, the righteous for the unrighteous, in order to bring you to God. 1 Peter 3:18
Living Redeemer, your sacrifice was for all, whether we chose to recognize you or not. Keep us among those who humbly remember and live in response to such unbelievable love. Amen.
19: God looks to the ends of the earth, and sees everything under the heavens. Job 28:24
It is not the will of your Father in heaven that one of these little ones should be lost. Matthew 18:14
Lord, you watch over us, and that is no small thing. Help us to remember this when we are feeling alone and lost. Remind us to keep our eyes open for others who may also be feeling lost. Amen.
20: When you make a sale to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor, you shall not cheat one another. Leviticus 25:14
We intend to do what is right not only in the Lord’s sight but also in the sight of others. 2 Corinthians 8:21

God of justice, give us the wisdom and strength to act with honesty and integrity. Remind us of our responsibility to both you and our communities to hold ourselves to the highest standards of your grace. Amen.
21: Naked I came from my mother’s womb, and naked I will depart. Job 1:21 NIV
Clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ. Romans 13:14 NIV
Lord, all the things in our lives will pass, but you will remain. Liberate us from the desire for things that really don’t matter and increase our desire for you. Amen.
22: Watchword for the week — The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid? Psalm 27:1
There is none like you, O Lord; you are great, and your name is great in might. Jeremiah 10:6
No one can lay any foundation other than the one that has been laid; that foundation is Jesus Christ. 1 Corinthians 3:11
Lord, keep us grounded in your love and aid us in the task of building opportunities for all to abide in your grace. Amen.
23: Do not let me be put to shame, for I take refuge in you. Psalm 25:20
The rain fell, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house, but it did not fall, because it had been founded on rock. Matthew 7:25
God, your love is our shield when the troubles of life would overwhelm us. The storms will pass as you remain our rock and our foundation. Thank you, Lord, for this comfort. Amen.
24: You have made the Most High your dwelling-place. Psalm 91:9
Jesus said, “Do not let your hearts be troubled. Believe in God, believe also in me.” John 14:1
God of glory, we place our trust in you. Regardless of the challenges and circumstance of each day, help us stand on the promises of your love for us. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
25: Whoever is steadfast in righteousness will live, but whoever pursues evil will die. Proverbs 11:19
Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled. Matthew 5:6
Lord, we hunger for so many things when our greatest hunger should be for you. Give us the desire to labor for justice and righteousness in the face of the injustices we see all around us. Amen.
26: You have put gladness in my heart more than when their grain and wine abound. Psalm 4:7
The kingdom of God is not food and drink but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit. Romans 14:17
God, fill our hearts with your Holy Spirit; sustain us with your power and strengthen our work for justice and peace in this world. Amen.
27: The righteous are like trees planted by streams of water, which yield their fruit in its season, and their leaves do not wither. Psalm 1:3

Paul wrote: This is my prayer, that your love may abound more and more in knowledge and depth of insight, filled with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ—to the glory and praise of God. Philippians 1:9,11 NIV

Creator, we pray that the seeds of love you plant in us will grow, not just for our benefit, but so that we may serve others. May your love overflow from our lives and touch all who are in need. Amen.
28: David said to the Philistine, “You come to me with sword and spear and javelin; but I come to you in the name of the Lord of hosts.” 1 Samuel 17:45
Do not conform to the pattern of this world. Romans 12:2 NIV

Source of justice, strengthen us to face the challenges of this day empowered by your transforming love. We ask for boldness to speak and act in hope against the violence, fear, and anxiety that harms us all. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
29: Watchword for the week — For the message about the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God. 1 Corinthians 1:18
Restore us, O Lord God of hosts; let your face shine, that we may be saved. Psalm 80:19
By the tender mercy of our God, the dawn from on high will break upon us, to give light to those who sit in darkness. Luke 1:78-79
Light of the world, empower us to carry your light to all. Make us beacons of love and encouragement, filled with patience and humility as we serve the world around us. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
30: The Lord our God protected us along all the way that we went. Joshua 24:17
And remember, I am with you always, to the end of the age. Matthew 28:20
God of all comfort, no matter what our circumstances may be, you remain faithful to us. Thank you for your abiding presence throughout our journey of life and faith. Amen.
31: God, you remain the same, and your years will never end. Psalm 102:27 NIV
Grace to you and peace from him who is and who was and who is to come. Revelation 1:4
Rock of ages, we are so grateful because, in the storms of our lives and the tumult of our times, you remain the same. It is on you we stand secure and know peace. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
32: Return to me, says the Lord of hosts, and I will return to you. Zechariah 1:3
The Lord is patient with you, not wanting any to perish, but all to come to repentance. 2 Peter 3:9

O Gracious King, our sins are many and we sometimes stray, yet your patience with us knows no bounds. As you call us to return, may we come to you with repentance and the hope for everlasting life. In your name, we pray. Amen.
33: I am watching over my word to perform it. Jeremiah 1:12
Jesus said, “Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets; I have come not to abolish but to fulfill.” Matthew 5:17

Loving Master, over the millennia your sons and daughters told us of your power and love. You gave us laws to live by and the words of your prophets told of glories to come. We rejoice that those words have been fulfilled in the sacrifice of your Son. In His name, we give you thanks. Amen.
34: You turn things upside down! Shall the potter be regarded as the clay? Shall the thing made say of its maker, “He did not make me”; or the thing formed say of the one who formed it, “He has no understanding?” Isaiah 29:16
We are what he has made us, created in Christ Jesus for good works. Ephesians 2:10

Heavenly Potter, we know you brought us into the world to do your will, yet there are times when we question the source of our being.  Help us to understand that you alone are the true power behind our lives, and that those lives are to be lived in your service. In your name, we pray. Amen.
35: Jacob made a vow, saying to God, “Of all that you give me I will surely give one-tenth to you.” Genesis 28:20,22
The one who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and the one who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully. 2 Corinthians 9:6

Faithful Gardener, you bestow upon us the unimaginable bounty of your love. All that we are, we owe to you. May we, in turn, give generously of ourselves to bring about your kingdom. Help us to grow, Lord, and help us to sow your love always. Amen.
36: Watchword for the week — For I decided to know nothing among you except Jesus Christ, and him crucified. 1 Corinthians 2:2
When times are good, be happy; but when times are bad, consider this: God has made the one as well as the other. Therefore, no one can discover anything about their future. Ecclesiastes 7:14 NIV
Look at the birds of the air; they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they? Matthew 6:26

Divine Creator, you make and care for all we know, yet much about you is unknowable. Give us strength during those times when we fail to understand your mystery, and help us know that no matter what, you feed us with your love. In your name, we pray. Amen.
37: The heart is devious above all else; it is perverse—who can understand it? I the Lord test the mind and search the heart, to give to all according to their ways. Jeremiah 17:9-10
So let us not grow weary in doing what is right, for we will reap at harvest time, if we do not give up. Galatians 6:9

Holy Teacher, you test our minds and search our hearts for the good we can offer the world. Help us grow that good, never surrender to evil or sloth, and endeavor to love you with all of our hearts, our souls, and our minds.  Amen.
38: As the rain and the snow come down from heaven, and do not return there until they have watered the earth, making it bring forth and sprout, giving seed to the sower and bread to the eater, so shall my word be that goes out from my mouth. Isaiah 55:10-11
If you abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask for whatever you wish, and it will be done for you. My Father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit and become my disciples. John 15:7-8

Generous Provider, you give us all we need to grow in faith, love, and hope. We are sustained by your heavenly waters and the love of your Son, who rescues us from darkness and sin. May our words and deeds bear fruit by bringing those in need to you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
39: Our heart is glad in the Lord, because we trust in his holy name. Psalm 33:21
Rejoice always, pray without ceasing. 1 Thessalonians 5:16-17

Rejoice, believers, rejoice! Lord, we know you as our trusting, loving, generous God, who gave us his Son so that we may be saved from hopeless sadness. We know, too, that you are with us always. May we rejoice in your holy name, for it gladdens our hearts. Amen.
40: Be silent before the Lord God! For the day of the Lord is at hand. Zephaniah 1:7
Therefore you also must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an unexpected hour. Matthew 24:44

Holy Redeemer, we await the hour of your return with hope and anticipation. While all we do should prepare us for that day, may we also live lives that demonstrate to all that your kingdom is at hand today. With hope, we pray. Amen.
41: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of those who bring good news, who proclaim peace, who bring good tidings, who proclaim salvation, who say to Zion, “Your God reigns!” Isaiah 52:7 NIV
As shoes for your feet put on whatever will make you ready to proclaim the gospel of peace. Ephesians 6:15

Bringer of peace, our world struggles to live in harmony. Our leaders choose war over compromise, battle over benevolence, and anger over forgiveness. Yet, if they only heard your word and walked your way, ours would be a world in unison.  We pray for peace. Amen.
42: Bring me out of prison, so that I may give thanks to your name. Psalm 142:7
So if the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed. John 8:36

Loving Sustainer, many of us find ourselves prisoners of our thoughts, deeds, and longings. We thank you for giving us your son, born to break the chains that keep us from you. Help us to overcome fear and oppression and help us share your message of freedom and peace. Amen.
43: Watchword for the week — Choose life so that you and your descendants may live, loving the Lord your God, obeying him, and holding fast to him. Deuteronomy 30:19,20
Take good care to love the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways. Joshua 22:5
Whoever serves me must follow me, and where I am, there will my servant be also. John 12:26

Abiding Shepherd, your nearness is our joy and guide. By your presence, we receive light for our path and purpose for our lives. May our lives demonstrate our gratitude for your love and ministry to us. We long to praise you, not only with our voices, but with lives of service to your children. Amen.
44: Do not cast me away from your presence, and do not take your holy spirit from me. Psalm 51:11
The tax collector, standing far off, would not even look up to heaven, but was beating his breast and saying, “God, be merciful to me, a sinner!” Luke 18:13

Merciful God, we recognize that we are the objects of your love, not by our own doing, but by your unmerited grace. Renew us by your Spirit and hold us in your loving embrace. Draw us ever nearer to yourself that our lives might overflow with joy and gratitude for your tender mercies. Amen.
45: Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart. Psalm 73: 1 NIV
Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God. Matthew 5:8

O God of Israel, for your temples, you have chosen neither stone nor wood. You chose our very hearts to be your dwelling place. By your spirit, may we keep our hearts pure and true—a fitting home for you. Amen.
46: I will again do amazing things with this people, shocking and amazing. The wisdom of their wise shall perish, and the discernment of the discerning shall be hidden. Isaiah 29:14
The crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel. Matthew 15:31

Source of wisdom and wonder, your way and wisdom are higher and truer than anything we could devise. The works of your creative hands and your transforming touch overwhelm us with wonder and adoration. May your living word be our only wisdom, and the works of your hands be our constant inspiration. Amen.
47: I called to the Lord out of my distress, and he answered me. Jonah 2:2
Jesus said, “Even the hairs of your head are all counted. Do not be afraid!” Luke 12:7

Merciful Deliverer, in all the challenges of our lives, you are sufficient. In our times of need, may we turn to you in confidence, trusting in your presence with us and love for us. May we live by your strength and the assurance that nothing can part us from your eternal love nor keep us from our eternal home. Amen.
48: O Lord, how manifold are your works! In wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of your creatures. Psalm 104:24
You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they existed and were created. Revelation 4:11

Holy and almighty Creator, if we were only to open our eyes in faith, we would see your undeniable fingerprints on the galaxies in the heavens, the wonders of the earth, and the abundant forms of life in our world. Help us open our eyes to see how great you are! Amen.
49: Whom have I in heaven but you? And there is nothing on earth that I desire other than you. Psalm 73:25

I am convinced that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor rulers, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers, nor height, nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord. Romans 8:38-39

Divine Companion, your presence in our lives may not eliminate the tough times, but no difficulty can separate us from you. You are always with us, even in the darkest of times. Even when all else may be gone, you remain. May we always turn to you for comfort, peace, and hope. Amen.
50: Watchword for the week — God said, “This is my Son, the Beloved; with him I am well pleased; listen to him!” Matthew 17:5
By day the Lord commands his steadfast love, and at night his song is with me, a prayer to the God of my life. Psalm 42:8
And after Jesus had dismissed the crowds, he went up the mountain by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone. Matthew 14:23

O Holy One, there is nowhere that we might go where you are not already there. May we remember that you are always with us and only a prayer away. May we remember to seek you in times of silence, free from distractions, and better able to discern your presence and commune with you. Amen.
51: “A mortal, born of woman, few of days and full of trouble, comes up like a flower and withers, flees like a shadow and does not last.” Job 14:1-2
Here we have no lasting city, but we are looking for the city that is to come. Hebrews 13:14

Eternal Creator, although our days in this life are numbered, we take comfort in the assurance that, just as you have neither beginning nor ending, so your love for us never ends. May your eternal love for us empower us to look to the future with holy expectation and confidence. Amen.
52: David said to the Lord, “I have sinned greatly in what I have done. But now, O Lord, I pray you, take away the guilt of your servant.” 2 Samuel 24:10
If we confess our sins, he who is faithful and just will forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness. 1 John 1:9

O Lamb of God, we are an imperfect people. All have sinned and fallen short of your will. Forgive us when we have strayed: for the evil we have done and good we have left undone. Cleanse us of our sin and renew us by your love. Amen.
53: Sing to the Lord; praise the Lord! For he has delivered the life of the needy from the hands of evildoers. Jeremiah 20:13
Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord, and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior, for he has looked with favor on the lowliness of his servant.” Luke 1:46-48

Strong Deliverer, we begin our Lenten journey with you today. Open our hearts and our minds anew to your sacrifice for us in order that we might know that God’s love for us is limitless, with neither beginning nor end. Amen.
54: Turn back from your evil ways; for why will you die? Ezekiel 33:11
Rescue us from the evil one. Matthew 6:13

O gracious Savior, we thank you that, in your divine mercy and grace, you have done for us what we were unable or unwilling to do for ourselves. You have called us to yourself. You have forgiven our sins, cleansed our hearts and lives, and healed us of our brokenness. Because of you, in all circumstances, we are able to sing, “It is well with my soul.” Amen.
55: I will make with you an everlasting covenant. Isaiah 55:3
In Christ every one of God’s promises is a “Yes.” For this reason it is through him that we say the “Amen,” to the glory of God. 2 Corinthians 1:20

Great Promise-keeper, in Jesus Christ, all of your promises and all of our hopes were fulfilled. We are loved. We are forgiven. We are saved. May our lives continue to sound forth the praise of which you are worthy. Gladly, forever, may we adore you. Amen.
56: Hear the word of the Lord, because the Lord has a charge to bring against you who live in the land: “There is no faithfulness, no love, no acknowledgment of God in the land.” Hosea 4:1 NIV
If any of you is lacking in wisdom, ask God, who gives to all generously and ungrudgingly, and it will be given you. James 1:5

Great Father, how often have you looked at the fields of our lives and found no harvest. Forgive us for the fruit we have failed to bear and the weeds we have sown. We thank you that you look to us not as a judge, but as a guide. Thank you for your wisdom, for showing us the better way. Thank you for the home you have prepared, even for sinners such as us. Amen.
57: Watchword for the week — Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, O righteous, and shout for joy, all you upright in heart. Psalm 32:11
The Lord will keep your foot from being caught. Proverbs 3:26
Jesus prayed, “I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but I ask you to protect them from the evil one.” John 17:15

Divine Protector, we thank you that you do not stand far off, keeping score of our faults. You observe us as a loving parent, anxious to prevent us from going astray and assisting us in learning the better way. Your desire is to deliver us from evil and place our feet upon the better path. Heavenly Father, we praise you for your nurturing love. Amen.
58: The Lord is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, and the peoples with equity. Psalm 98:9
Lord, who will not fear and glorify your name? For you alone are holy. All nations will come and worship before you, for your judgments have been revealed. Revelation 15:4

O righteous Judge, as you weigh the nations and people of the world in the scale of your will, we are comforted that you are motivated by love for all your children with an eye toward justice and equity. May we look to your reign as an expression of your love and as a longing for the fulfillment of justice for all your children. Amen.
59: Out of the depths I cry to you, O Lord. Lord, hear my voice! Psalm 130:1-2

The blind man shouted, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!” Those who were in front sternly ordered him to be quiet; but he shouted even more loudly, “Son of David, have mercy on me!” Luke 18:38-39

O merciful Savior, too often our prayers are limited to times when we are in distress and call on you for help. May your Holy Spirit move within our hearts to call us to prayers of praise and gratitude for your goodness and blessing of our lives. Amen.
60: Beginning of the Unity of the Brethren in Bohemia
The king said to Daniel, “Truly, your God is God of gods and Lord of kings.” Daniel 2:47
Paul said, “King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you do believe.” Then Agrippa said to Paul, “You almost persuade me to become a Christian.” Acts 26:27-28 NKJV

Lord, some days our faith is strong—some days we are only “almost persuaded.” Lord God, work to persuade us and those holding power in human affairs, that our true identity is found as creatures who are loved by you and who, in response, are serving you. Amen.
61: The Lord said to Jacob, “Know that I am with you and will keep you wherever you go, and will bring you back to this land.” Genesis 28:15
The one who calls you is faithful, and he will do this. 1 Thessalonians 5:24

Faithful One, our world is filled with unfaithfulness—in our families, in our neighborhoods, in our government, in our businesses. Help us remain faithful wherever we go. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
62: You have set my feet in a broad place. Psalm 31:8
I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you. Ephesians 1:18 NIV

Lord of history, the psalmist and our ancestors believed all things are in your control. Perhaps we have a clearer sense of both our human powers and our human limits. Increase our confidence, that in the end, you will heal and restore your creation. Amen.
63: The promises of the Lord are promises that are pure, silver refined in a furnace on the ground, purified seven times. Psalm 12:6
The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life. John 6:63

The centurion answered, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof; but only speak the word, and my servant will be healed.” Matthew 8:8

“Make me a captive, Lord, and then I shall be free.” What a seeming contradiction! What a promise! We are at our best, not when we are alone, but when we are connected both to you and to one another. Lord, capture us. Amen.

It is God who is at work in you, enabling you both to will and to work for his good pleasure. Philippians 2:13

Creator of all things, we give you thanks for the wonderful planet you have given us. In many ways, we have not cared for it well. Help us to repent and make the difficult choices to better care for our planet. Amen.

Jesus, light of the world, amid both the gaudy lights and the dark corners of this life, we need a sense of glory—especially the glory we see in you. And when we see that glory, may that glory, that light, shine through us. Amen.

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and the God of all consolation. 2 Corinthians 1:3
Eternal God, you endure forever. How can we mortals understand that? We thank you for our Lord Jesus Christ, whose resurrection and continuing life among us give us a taste of “forever.” Amen.

God is love, and those who abide in love abide in God, and God abides in them. 1 John 4:16

Loving God, we are “the apple of your eye”—a gift, not a reward for anything we have done. May that gift so shape us that we are indeed lovers of both strangers and our neighbors, especially those whom the world ignores or forgets. Amen.

Whoever is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much; and whoever is dishonest in a very little is dishonest also in much. Luke 16:10

Ever-living God, surrounded by changes and falsehoods, we often doubt that anything is true or dependable. Enable us to trust you as the truth upon which we can rely, so that we may be faithful people. Amen.

For the gate is narrow and the road is hard that leads to life, and there are few who find it. Matthew 7:14
Lord God, your way is not easy. It is narrow. But despite our failures and our going astray, your way is what you have made us for, and what leads us to genuine life. Amen.

There is no holy one like the Lord, no one besides you. 1 Samuel 2:2
As he who called you is holy, be holy yourselves in all your conduct. 1 Peter 1:15
Divine Companion, we are shaped by the company we keep. We need your company, so touch us that we may know we have been with you and have been changed. Amen.

Good Shepherd, sometimes we are lost and yearn to be found. More often, we don’t even know we are lost. Help us to know the joy of being found by you. Amen.

Jesus said, “Blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it!” Luke 11:28 NKJV

Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God. Matthew 5:9

No one has ever seen God. It is God the only Son, who is close to the Father’s heart, who has made him known. John 1:18

Jesus said, “As you go, proclaim the good news, ‘The kingdom of heaven has come near.’” Matthew 10:7

We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body. 2 Corinthians 4:10 NIV

91: The Lord will not cast away his people, for his great name’s sake. 1 Samuel 12:22
If we are faithless, he remains faithful—for he cannot deny himself. 2 Timothy 2:13

So many times, God, we have turned away from you, giving you every reason to turn away from us. Yet, patiently and persistently, you pull us back from our pride and selfishness. You labor to restore us to yourself and to one another. Thank you, faithful God. Amen.

I will turn their mourning into joy. Jeremiah 31:13
Jesus said, “Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.” Matthew 5:4

Jesus of Nazareth, as you rode into Jerusalem, ride into our hearts today. Hear us as we shout, “Blessed is the One who comes in the name of the Lord.” Let us bless you even as you bless and comfort us with freedom, purpose, and joy. Amen.

Let us look to Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of our faith, who for the sake of the joy that was set before him endured the cross, disregarding its shame. Hebrews 12:2

When our eyes wander from you, Lord, we see only the brokenness of human striving and despair. Yet, even on that bleak horizon, we also see your arms stretched out on the cross. We see you, Lord, beginning and ending everything with love. Amen.
94: Fear not, O land; Be glad and rejoice, for the Lord has done marvelous things! Joel 2:21 NKJV

The whole multitude of the disciples began to praise God joyfully with a loud voice for all the deeds of power that they had seen, saying, “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!” Luke 19:37-38

We lift up our loud voices. We praise and welcome you, Lord. We give thanks because you ride boldly into our lives, our cities, and nations. You bring health, healing, and hope that God’s mercy and justice will prevail in the world around us. Amen.

You know the generous act of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, so that by his poverty you might become rich. 2 Corinthians 8:9

Thank you, justice-loving God. Seeing our hungry bodies and empty hearts, you give us your commandments and show us the way to live in harmony with one another. Knowing we need still more, you show us that self-sacrificing love—yours and ours—enriches your world with mercy and peace. Amen.
96: Maundy Thursday — He has gained renown by his wonderful deeds; the Lord is gracious and merciful. Psalm 111:4
God said, “As long as the earth endures, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night, shall not cease.” Genesis 8:22

Jesus took a loaf of bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body, which is given for you. As faithful as the cycles of day and night, and seedtime and harvest may be, you, Lord, are even more faithful. You invite us again and again to your table as treasured guests. We give thanks, fully and freely without end, that you give yourself to us in love. Amen.
97: Good Friday — For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life. John 3:16
O taste and see that the Lord is good; happy are those who take refuge in him. Psalm 34:8
One of the criminals said, “Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom.” He replied, “Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.” Luke 23:42-43

Christ, even as we see you hang upon the cross, we pray a humble, earnest plea. May we savor the taste of your forgiveness and the sweetness of your love in this life and in the life yet to come. Amen.
98: The Lord drew me up from the desolate pit, out of the miry bog, and set my feet upon a rock, making my steps secure. Psalm 40:2
Christ was put to death in the flesh, but made alive in the spirit, in which also he went and made a proclamation to the spirits in prison. 1 Peter 3:18-19
Jesus, when we are in prison, entombed in the consequences of our own sin, speak to us words of hope. Pull us up, set us free. Place our feet securely on the solid rock of your love. Amen.
99: Watchword for the week — So if you have been raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Colossians 3:1
I lie down and sleep; I wake again, for the Lord sustains me. Psalm 3:5

After Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons. She went out and told those who had been with him, while they were mourning and weeping. Mark 16:9-10

Refreshed by sleep, help us rise to live a new day. With eyes that see more clearly in morning’s light, help us, Lord, to recognize Christ alive among us, bringing us hope and purpose. May we, like Mary, tell those still weary with night’s mourning, “Christ is risen! Alleluia.” Amen.
100: The Lord will fight for you, and you have only to keep still. Exodus 14:14
Thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. 1 Corinthians 15:57

Life’s enemies threaten—poverty, sickness, disaster, doubt, death. Let me hide behind you, defender God, as you battle them on my behalf. Let my troubled soul be still, trusting that your love and mercy will prevail, protecting me and the whole of your creation. Amen.
101: You have made the Lord your refuge. Psalm 91:9
For just as the sufferings of Christ are abundant for us, so also our consolation is abundant through Christ. 2 Corinthians 1:5

Protector God, when fierce storms threaten, you give us shelter and refuge under your wings like a mother hen. You murmur comforting words of consolation that all will be well. We give thanks that you care for us and raise us up, even as you cared for and raised up Christ. Amen.
102: I—My hands—stretched out the heavens, and all their host I have commanded. Isaiah 45:12 NKJV
Every generous act of giving, with every perfect gift, is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shadow due to change. James 1:17

As energy streams from the sun, giving light and food to the earth, so even the universe itself, with all its light and love, streams from you, creator God. May your creative energy be the source of our own gifts in return: caring for and revering creation. Amen.
103: Lord, in your great mercies you did not make an end of your people or forsake them. Nehemiah 9:31
Jesus said, “Because I live, you also will live.” John 14:19

In a world full of negative “becauses” that lead to despair and isolation, thank you, God, for being the loving “because” that leads us to hope and community. Give us the “because” that we need today to live as your people, working for your justice and peace. Amen.

Son of David, just and kind ruler, set us free from the prisons and chains of our own and other’s making. Release us from poverty to enjoy your abundance. Release us from guilt to experience forgiveness. Release us from despair to live with hope and purpose. Amen.

Extol the Lord our God; worship at his footstool. Holy is he! Psalm 99:5

Drawing strength from one another, we wait for you, Lord. Let your powerful Spirit move among us. Make us bold, not only to tell your story with words, but to live your story by feeding the hungry, healing the sick, caring for the land, and welcoming the stranger. Amen.

108: The king of Israel, the Lord, is in your midst; you shall fear disaster no more. Zephaniah 3:15

109: I will save you that you may become a blessing. Zechariah 8:13 NASB
Not that we are competent of ourselves to claim anything as coming from us; our competence is from God. 2 Corinthians 3:5

Save us, Lord, so that we too may be a blessing. Wash away our guilt, so that we may forgive. Heal us, so that we may alleviate pain. Fill us with hope and courage, so that we may offer a despairing world the light of your justice and love. Amen.
110: The Lord said, “I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake.” 2 Kings 19:34
Do not be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom. Luke 12:32

Defend us, Lord, from the self-delusions, doubts, and despairs that defy our hope in your coming kingdom. Cast away our fears. Gather us up gently. Reign over us with mercy and justice, so that every living thing may peacefully enjoy the abundance of your creation. Amen.
111: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor. Exodus 20:16
Let come out of your mouths what is useful for building up, as there is need, so that your words may give grace to those who hear. Ephesians 4:29

God, the word who spoke creation into being, God, the word who teaches us how to love each other, make us value the power of our own words to create and encourage. Help us speak words of comfort and hope, truth and justice, joy and peace. Amen.

“Who can hide in secret places so that I cannot see them?” says the Lord. “Do I not fill heaven and earth?” Jeremiah 23:24

114: My soul waits for the Lord more than those who watch for the morning. Psalm 130:6

In the quiet dark of night, we wait for the earth to make its trustworthy turn into day, for early gray dawn to light our way. We wait too for you, trustworthy God. In new morning light, help us live embraced by your love, motivated by your will. Amen.
115: Light shines in the darkness for the upright; [he is] gracious, compassionate, and righteous. Psalm 112:4 NASB

116: There shall once more be heard the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voices of those who sing, “Give thanks to the Lord of hosts, for the Lord is good, for his steadfast love endures forever!” Jeremiah 33:10-11
The grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all. Titus 2:11

Steadfastly, without fail, you care for us in every time and place, through every joy, change, and hardship. 117: I formed you, you are my servant; O Israel, you will not be forgotten by me. Isaiah 44:21
Has God rejected his people? By no means! Romans 11:1

Lord, you extend love and mercy, and call and purpose to Israel—your ancient covenant people—and to all those who inherit your history of leading and guiding them. We give thanks that we, and every other human family, are never beyond the reach of your patient, persistent love. Amen.
118: One who puts on armor should not brag like one who takes it off. 1 Kings 20:11

Every gift comes from you, Lord. May your blessings of wealth and security lead us not to arrogant pride but to humble gratitude. May our gratitude for your gifts lead us not to clutch them tightly, but to open our hands and freely share them with love. Amen.

121: How great are God’s signs, how mighty his wonders! His kingdom is an eternal kingdom; his dominion endures from generation to generation. Daniel 4:3 NIV

Sometimes, Lord, we doubt that we can truly have healed hearts, restored relationships, and forgiven, fruitful lives. We seek your forgiveness and we offer forgiveness and love to others as you have offered to us, so that our hearts find a real home in you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
123: You shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy. Leviticus 19:2
